channel.title: NEED HELP---MAC---solved thank you brain
channel.description:
I know its off topic but i cant find where i would put this i have windows xp on my mac desktop running loin osx and i most of the servers i downlaoded (sources) dont work as xp i guess is to old, as it shows that picture that the object cant be opened, so I downloaded vmware fusion on my macbook pro and am trying to install windows vista, but the torrent was i guess 2 disks and i cant find any windows vista ones that are 1 disk and in english
my question is :
How would i install vista with 2 disks using vmware fusion 4?/anything on my mac?
Can i make them into one iso and than use vmware?
Is there a way i could play on any server using xp?
i downloaded runeedit or w.e that one is its from google and i cba to find the link as its 1am... it crashes when my client loads 100% and the person who relased it said i had a shitty computer so im getting vista on it since i have xp limited to my auto swicther (which doesnt work now -.-)
any way i could play+use edit + the server on xp? (basically not have i cash) its java is upto date
please no trolls/useless replies if your not gana help be good and click the back button
and sorry if its in the wrong section i dont know where else i could post this
Thanks for any help what so ever!
found the solution ty for the people who dint make a useless post

item.title: NEED HELP---MAC---solved thank you brain
item.dc:creator: @dropthebeat dropthebeat
item.description:
@dropthebeat wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:4, topic:431300”]I don’t really know understand your dilemma, but this is what I think about Macs hosting servers:

I find my Mac the easiest to host with. You have to learn some shell commands and translate the batch files (usually very easy once you figure it out). I advise you ask how to translate these scripts instead of installing a new OS.

Then all you have to do is run the shell script in Terminal :D[/quote]

id rather host them on windows since i know how to host on windows

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP---MAC---solved thank you brain
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

I don’t really know understand your dilemma, but this is what I think about Macs hosting servers:

I find my Mac the easiest to host with. You have to learn some shell commands and translate the batch files (usually very easy once you figure it out). I advise you ask how to translate these scripts instead of installing a new OS.

Then all you have to do is run the shell script in Terminal

Read full topic
